body:
Hi!
I see that support for my device was added in commit https://github.com/dlnraja/com.tuya.zigbee/commit/9a6564b4bfd8f5caa5af81abadfbc7415a6594b0 (TS0501B / _TZB210_ngnt8kni). Thank you!

However, after updating, removing the old device and re-pairing, Homey adds it as ÔÇ£Smart Bulb DimmerÔÇØ instead of the new Dimmable LED Driver profile. (Led controller cct) This device is not a bulb, it is a 24V LED strip driver (LED controller CCT). Thanks again for the quick implementation

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fb6036e9-7a21-43d3-a810-5f8d3c901dd5)
title: WoodUpp / Tuya 24V LED Driver

body: ## ­ƒô▒ Basic Information **Brand & Model**: WoodUpp / Tuya 24V LED Driver **Purchase Link**: https://woodupp.no/produkt/led/?attribute_pa_led_qty=pakke-med-5-led **Power Source**: [ ] Battery / [x] Mains **Current Status**: [ ] Not pairing / [x] Pairs but missing features / [ ] Not working at all --- ## ­ƒöì Zigbee Fingerprint (MANDATORY) Please provide this information from Homey Developer Tools: Manufacturer: _TZB210_ngnt8kni Product ID (Model): TS0501B Device Type: router Firmware: - Capabilities missing: dim Currently added as: Unknown Zigbee Device ### How to Get Fingerprint: 1. Pair device with Homey 2. Go to Developer Tools ÔåÆ Devices ÔåÆ [Your Device] 3. Click "Advanced" tab 4. Screenshot OR copy the information above **Screenshot or fingerprint data**: ``` Paste fingerprint here ``` --- ## ­ƒôè TS0601 Data Points (if applicable) Not applicable ÔÇö device is NOT TS0601/DATA-POINT based. It is a standard Tuya LED Dimmer (TS0501B). --- ## ­ƒöù References **Zigbee2MQTT**: (link if exists) **Home Assistant/ZHA**: (link if exists) **Other documentation**: (any other helpful links) Device page for TS0501B: https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/supported-devices/#tuya_ts0501b --- ## Ô£¿ Expected Capabilities What features should work? Check all that apply: - [x] On/Off - [x] Brightness/Dim - [ ] Temperature - [ ] Humidity - [ ] Motion detection - [ ] Contact sensor - [ ] Battery level - [ ] Energy monitoring (power, current, voltage) - [ ] Other: _________ --- ## ­ƒôØ Additional Notes ÔÇó The device pairs with Homey Pro but is added as Unknown Zigbee Device ÔÇó Dimming is not exposed ÔÇó This device should be handled as a Tuya ÔÇ£TS0501B DimmerÔÇØ ÔÇó Please add fingerprint to Tuya Zigbee app so it binds On/Off (0x0006) and Level Control (0x0008)
title: Add support for TS0501B / _TZB210_ngnt8kni (Tuya 24V LED Driver)
Tuya Zigbee Temperature Humidity Sensor with LCD Screen ZTH05Z
Device Request - Curtain motor - Tuya / _TZE200_uj3f4wr5

body:
## Basic Info
- **Brand**: Tuya
- **Model** (printed on label): TS0601 ZTH02 v1.0
- **Manufacturer Name** (from Homey dev tools): _TZE200_9yapgbuv
- **Model ID** (e.g., TS0601, TS0011, TS011F): TS0601

## Evidence

This device is currently registered as a "sound controller", but this is a temperature/humidity sensor.

Original upstream issue for implementation with all necessary details: 
https://github.com/JohanBendz/com.tuya.zigbee/issues/850
title: [DEVICE] TS0601_TZE200_9yapgbuv incorrectly defined as sound controller

body:
­ƒô▒ Basic Information

Brand & Model: Avatto TRV06 Zigbee Radiator Thermostat Valve
Purchase Link: [Aliexpress](https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005008158452301.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.35.230779d2FZPLZE&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld)
Power Source: Ôÿæ Battery
Current Status: Ôÿæ Pairs but missing features
(Added as ÔÇ£Unknown Zigbee DeviceÔÇØ in Homey)

­ƒöì Zigbee Fingerprint (MANDATORY)

Manufacturer Name: _TZE200_hvaxb2tc
Model ID: TS0601
Endpoints: (as detected by Homey ÔÇô included in diagnostics report below)
Clusters: (from diagnostics report)

How to Get Fingerprint:

Already paired ÔÇô data included below.

Screenshot or fingerprint data:

Manufacturer: _TZE200_hvaxb2tc
Model: TS0601
Device: Radiator TRV
Brand: Avatto
Model: TRV06
Identifies as: TS0601 Tuya thermostat
Device added as: Unknown Zigbee Device in Homey

­ƒôè TS0601 Data Points (if applicable)

Device uses the common Tuya TS0601 data point structure.

(Exact DP mapping depends on firmware, but typical TRV mappings expected are:)

DP ID | Function | Example Value | Read/Write -- | -- | -- | -- 1 | Target temperature setpoint | 200 (20.0┬░C) | RW 2 | Heating mode / system run state | 0/1 | R 3 | Schedule mode | 0/1 | RW 4 | Battery (%) | 87 | R 16 | Valve opening position | 0ÔÇô100 | R 20 | Child lock | 0/1 | RW

If the developer needs the exact values, they can be extracted from the full diagnostics report.

­ƒöù References

Zigbee2MQTT (same hardware family):
https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/devices/TS0601_thermostat.html

Home Assistant / ZHA reference:
https://github.com/zigpy/zha-device-handlers/issues?q=TS0601

No official Avatto documentation found beyond sales listing.

Ô£¿ Expected Capabilities

Please add support for the following TRV features:

  • On/Off

  • Temperature (read)

  • Target temperature (write/setpoint)

  • Battery level

  • Valve position

  • Child lock

  • Window detection (if exposed by firmware)

Additional TRV features commonly available on this model:

  • Schedule mode

  • Boost mode

  • Manual/Auto modes

­ƒôØ Additional Notes

  • Device pairs successfully via Universal Tuya Zigbee but is identified as Unknown Zigbee Device because the fingerprint _TZE200_hvaxb2tc is not yet included in the TS0601 TRV driver.

  • Adding this fingerprint to the TS0601 thermostat mapping should resolve full functionality.

  • Many similar Avatto TRV models work once their _TZE200_ÔÇª variant is added.
title: [DEVICE] Thermostat Radiator Valve

body:
### Feature Type

New capability (e.g., color control, scenes)

### Problem Statement

Hi @dlnraja, I appreciate your effort to pick up and improve the com.tuya.zigbee application. I noticed my PRs don't get merged and the project has not been updated for a while and found this as an alternative. I'd like to see if I can help out a little.

I found a bug which causes me to not be able to open configuration in settings. I have fixed this issue along with other things. Unfortunately I am restricted to create a pull request. Could you give public access to it?

### Proposed Solution

See message above.

### Alternatives Considered

_No response_

### Examples

_No response_

### Priority (Your Opinion)

Critical - Blocking my use case

### Affected Devices

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched for similar feature requests
- [x] This feature aligns with local Zigbee control
- [x] I'm willing to help test this feature
- [ ] I can provide technical details if needed
title: [Feature] Making pull requests public

## Publish Failed
  
  **Version:** 3.1.1

Device Vibration sensor is added, but as switch.
When trying to add the socket, it breaks off and says an internal error has occurred and adds nothing.

I have tried to add both a few times and get the same result every time.
